title: John Chapter 13 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on John chapter 13 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: John Chapter 13 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of John Chapter 13.

questions.question: Before which feast did Jesus know that his hour had come to depart from this world?
questions.correctAnswer: Feast of Passover
questions.explanation: John 13:1 states that Jesus knew his hour had come before the feast of the Passover.

questions.question: Who was influenced by the devil to betray Jesus?
questions.correctAnswer: Judas Iscariot
questions.explanation: John 13:2 explains that the devil put into the heart of Judas Iscariot to betray Jesus.

questions.question: What did Jesus do after rising from supper?
options: Laid aside his garments and girded himself with a towel
questions.correctAnswer: Laid aside his garments and girded himself with a towel
questions.explanation: John 13:4 says Jesus laid aside his garments and took a towel to gird himself.

questions.question: What did Jesus do with the water and basin?
questions.correctAnswer: Washed the disciples' feet
questions.explanation: John 13:5 details that Jesus poured water into a basin and began to wash the disciples' feet.

questions.question: Who asked Jesus, 'Lord, dost thou wash my feet?'
questions.correctAnswer: Simon Peter
questions.explanation: John 13:6 shows that Simon Peter asked Jesus if He was washing his feet.

questions.question: What did Peter say when Jesus told him he must wash his feet?
options: Never will you wash my feet
I will wash your feet instead
questions.correctAnswer: Never will you wash my feet
questions.explanation: In John 13:8, Peter replied that Jesus would never wash his feet.

questions.question: What did Jesus say about the servant and the lord?
options: The servant is greater than the lord
The servant is not greater than the lord
The lord serves only some servants
questions.correctAnswer: The servant is not greater than the lord
questions.explanation: John 13:16 states that the servant is not greater than his lord.

questions.question: Who did Jesus say was not clean among the disciples?
questions.correctAnswer: Judas Iscariot
questions.explanation: John 13:11 indicates Jesus knew who would betray him and said not all were clean, referring to Judas.

questions.question: What was the new commandment Jesus gave to His disciples?
options: Love one another as I have loved you
questions.correctAnswer: Love one another as I have loved you
questions.explanation: John 13:34 records Jesus giving a new commandment to love one another as He loved them.

questions.question: How will all men know that you are Jesus' disciples?
options: By your love for one another
By your knowledge of the scriptures
questions.correctAnswer: By your love for one another
questions.explanation: John 13:35 says all men will know Jesus' disciples by their love for one another.

questions.question: Who leaned on Jesus' bosom at the supper?
questions.correctAnswer: John
questions.explanation: John 13:23 describes the disciple whom Jesus loved leaning on His bosom.

questions.question: True or False: Judas Iscariot left the supper immediately after receiving the sop from Jesus.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: John 13:30 states Judas received the sop and immediately went out, and it was night.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus said to Peter that he would not deny Him three times before the rooster crowed.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: John 13:38 states Jesus told Peter that before the rooster crowed, he would deny Him three times.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus said that those who receive whom He sends also receive Him and the Father who sent Him.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: John 13:20 clearly states that receiving those Jesus sends is receiving Him and God who sent Him.

questions.question: Complete this verse from John 13:9: 'Lord, not my feet only, but also my ______ and my head.'
questions.correctAnswer: hands
questions.explanation: John 13:9 records Peter asking Jesus to wash not only his feet but also his hands and head.

medium.title: John Chapter 13 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from John Chapter 13 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with pride and refuses to serve others. Based on John 13, what biblical truth would you share about humility?
options: Jesus set an example by washing His disciples' feet, showing that true leaders serve others.
Pride is a sign of strength and should be maintained.
Serving others is optional for believers.
Only pastors and church leaders are called to serve others.
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus set an example by washing His disciples' feet, showing that true leaders serve others.
questions.explanation: John 13:4-5, 12-15 show Jesus humbling Himself to wash the disciples' feet and commanding them to do likewise, teaching that humble service is essential for His followers.

questions.question: How does John 13 teach us about obedience and love in the Christian life?
options: We show that we are Jesus' disciples by loving one another as He loved us.
Love is less important than following strict rules.
Obedience is only necessary for outward actions, not the heart.
Love should be shown only to close friends.
questions.correctAnswer: We show that we are Jesus' disciples by loving one another as He loved us.
questions.explanation: John 13:34-35 clearly states that Jesus gave a new commandment to love one another as He loved them, and this love is the identifying mark of His disciples.

questions.question: A believer is facing temptation to betray their faith under pressure. What encouragement does John 13 offer about perseverance and trust in God?
options: Jesus knew of Judas' betrayal but fulfilled Scripture and trusted the Father's plan.
Believers will never face betrayal or hardship.
It is acceptable to give up when tempted.
God abandons those who falter in temptation.
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus knew of Judas' betrayal but fulfilled Scripture and trusted the Father's plan.
questions.explanation: John 13:11, 18-19 show Jesus' awareness of the betrayal but His trust in God's plan and fulfillment of Scripture, encouraging believers to trust God even in trials.

questions.question: What does Jesus' act of washing the disciples' feet teach us about serving others in the church community?
options: Followers of Christ should humbly serve one another just as Jesus served.
Only leaders in the church should serve.
Serving others is a sign of weakness.
Service is unnecessary if one is spiritually mature.
questions.correctAnswer: Followers of Christ should humbly serve one another just as Jesus served.
questions.explanation: John 13:14-15 instructs believers that since Jesus, their Lord and Master, washed their feet, they ought to serve one another humbly in love.

questions.question: How does John 13 encourage believers to live with integrity and honesty within their fellowship?
options: Jesus openly acknowledged Judas as the betrayer, showing the importance of truth even when difficult.
It is better to conceal faults to maintain peace.
Dishonesty is acceptable if it protects the group.
We should ignore sin among believers to avoid conflict.
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus openly acknowledged Judas as the betrayer, showing the importance of truth even when difficult.
questions.explanation: John 13:21-27 records Jesus revealing the betrayer openly, teaching that honesty and confronting sin are necessary even in close fellowship.

questions.question: A fellow believer is uncertain about following Jesus through difficult times. Based on John 13, what assurance can you share?
options: Although you may not follow Jesus now, you will follow Him later.
Following Jesus is always easy and without trials.
If you fail now, you cannot follow Jesus later.
Only the strongest can follow Jesus.
questions.correctAnswer: Although you may not follow Jesus now, you will follow Him later.
questions.explanation: John 13:36 shows Jesus telling Peter he cannot follow Him now but will follow Him afterward, offering hope despite current difficulties.

questions.question: What does John 13 teach about the relationship between servant and master in God's kingdom?
options: The servant is not greater than the master, so believers should humble themselves.
Servants are greater than their masters.
Believers should seek to be above others.
Masters do not serve their servants.
questions.correctAnswer: The servant is not greater than the master, so believers should humble themselves.
questions.explanation: John 13:16 teaches that the servant is not greater than his lord, encouraging humility and service among believers.

questions.question: How does John 13 instruct believers about love as a witness to the world?
options: By loving one another, all will know you are Jesus' disciples.
Love is a private matter and does not affect others.
Faith without love is sufficient for witness.
questions.correctAnswer: By loving one another, all will know you are Jesus' disciples.
questions.explanation: John 13:35 states that love among believers is the clear mark identifying them as disciples to the world.

questions.question: A believer is confused about the significance of Jesus' actions at the Last Supper. How does John 13 explain the purpose of Jesus washing the disciples' feet?
options: To give an example that believers should serve one another humbly.
To demonstrate Jesus' superiority over the disciples.
To show that only Peter needed cleansing.
To institute a new religious ritual.
questions.correctAnswer: To give an example that believers should serve one another humbly.
questions.explanation: John 13:15 emphasizes Jesus giving the example of humble service for believers to follow.

questions.question: What does John 13 teach about the importance of recognizing and obeying God's timing?
options: Jesus knew His hour had come to depart and acted accordingly.
Timing is irrelevant in God's plan.
Believers should act only when they feel ready.
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus knew His hour had come to depart and acted accordingly.
questions.explanation: John 13:1 shows Jesus' awareness of the appointed time to fulfill His mission, demonstrating submission to God's timing.

questions.question: True or False: According to John 13, Jesus promised that those who receive His sent ones receive Him and the Father.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: John 13:20 states that receiving those Jesus sends is equivalent to receiving Him and the One who sent Him.

questions.question: True or False: Peter was confident he would never deny Jesus according to John 13.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: John 13:37 records Peter confidently saying he will lay down his life for Jesus, indicating his belief he would not deny Him.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Jesus gave a new ________ that you love one another, as I have loved you.
questions.correctAnswer: commandment
questions.explanation: John 13:34 explicitly states Jesus gave a new commandment to love as He loved.

questions.question: How does John 13 teach us about dealing with betrayal within the Christian community?
options: Jesus acknowledged the betrayal openly but continued in love and purpose.
Betrayal should be ignored and not discussed.
Betrayal is unforgivable and leads to exclusion.
Believers should seek revenge for betrayal.
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus acknowledged the betrayal openly but continued in love and purpose.
questions.explanation: John 13:21-27 shows Jesus revealing Judas' betrayal openly, yet He remains focused on God's redemptive plan.

questions.question: What practical lesson about serving others can we learn from Peter's reaction to Jesus washing his feet?
options: Peter initially resisted but accepted when he understood the spiritual meaning, showing believers should be willing to receive humble service.
Peter refused to ever be served by anyone.
Peter thought foot washing was unnecessary for all.
Peter believed only Jesus could serve others.
questions.correctAnswer: Peter initially resisted but accepted when he understood the spiritual meaning, showing believers should be willing to receive humble service.
questions.explanation: John 13:6-9 shows Peter's initial refusal and then acceptance of Jesus washing his feet, teaching openness to humble service for spiritual cleansing.

hard.title: John Chapter 13 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from John Chapter 13.

questions.question: What significant act did Jesus perform at the supper that demonstrates servant leadership?
questions.correctAnswer: He washed the disciples' feet
questions.explanation: Jesus rose from supper, laid aside his garments, took a towel, and washed the disciples' feet, demonstrating humility and servant leadership (John 13:4-5).

questions.question: In John 13, what is the significance of Jesus giving a 'new commandment'?
options: To love one another as He has loved them
To follow the Law of Moses strictly
questions.correctAnswer: To love one another as He has loved them
questions.explanation: Jesus commands his disciples to love one another as He has loved them, emphasizing a radical, self-giving love (John 13:34).

questions.question: Which disciple did Jesus identify as the betrayer by giving him a dipped sop?
questions.correctAnswer: Judas Iscariot
questions.explanation: Jesus gave the dipped sop to Judas Iscariot, identifying him as the one who would betray Him (John 13:26).

questions.question: What Old Testament scripture is Jesus fulfilling when He says, 'He that eateth bread with me hath lifted up his heel against me'?
questions.correctAnswer: Psalm 41:9
questions.explanation: Jesus alludes to Psalm 41:9, which speaks of a close friend who betrays, fulfilling prophecy about His betrayal (John 13:18).

questions.question: What does Jesus mean by saying, 'If I wash thee not, thou hast no part with me' to Peter?
options: Partaking in Jesus' mission requires cleansing and humility
Peter is not worthy to be a disciple
questions.correctAnswer: Partaking in Jesus' mission requires cleansing and humility
questions.explanation: Jesus indicates that spiritual cleansing symbolized by washing is necessary to belong to Him and participate in His work (John 13:8).

questions.question: What literary device is used in John 13:16 when Jesus says, 'The servant is not greater than his lord'?
questions.correctAnswer: Proverbial parallelism
questions.explanation: The statement is a proverb showing the relationship between servant and lord, illustrating humility through parallelism (John 13:16).

questions.question: How does the act of foot washing in John 13 relate typologically to Old Testament purification rituals?
options: It symbolizes spiritual cleansing like the Levitical washings
questions.correctAnswer: It symbolizes spiritual cleansing like the Levitical washings
questions.explanation: Foot washing symbolizes purification and humility, paralleling Old Testament ritual washings that signified holiness and cleanliness (John 13:10).

questions.question: True or False: Jesus openly revealed to all disciples who the betrayer was immediately after saying he would be betrayed.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: The disciples doubted and looked at one another after Jesus said someone would betray Him; He did not openly reveal the betrayer until later (John 13:21-22).

questions.question: What does Jesus mean when He says, 'Ye are clean, but not all' in John 13:10?
options: All disciples were spiritually clean except Judas
questions.correctAnswer: All disciples were spiritually clean except Judas
questions.explanation: Jesus acknowledges the disciples' general purity but excludes Judas, who was the betrayer (John 13:10-11).

questions.question: How does Jesus' declaration, 'Now is the Son of man glorified,' relate to His impending crucifixion?
options: His death will reveal God's glory
He will reign as king immediately
He will ascend to heaven at once
questions.correctAnswer: His death will reveal God's glory
questions.explanation: Jesus indicates that His glorification through the cross will manifest God's glory (John 13:31).

questions.question: Which Greek word underlying 'Lord' in John 13:13 emphasizes authority as well as respect, fitting Jesus' role as teacher and master?
questions.correctAnswer: Kyrios
questions.explanation: The word 'Kyrios' denotes both lordship and respect, highlighting Jesus' authority as Master and Lord (John 13:13).

questions.question: What does the term 'sop' refer to in the cultural context of John 13, especially in the act of Judas receiving it?
options: A piece of bread dipped in sauce
questions.correctAnswer: A piece of bread dipped in sauce
questions.explanation: A 'sop' was a morsel of bread dipped in sauce or broth, symbolizing fellowship; Jesus giving it to Judas signaled the betrayal (John 13:26).

questions.question: How does the theme of love in John 13:34-35 anticipate the Great Commandment found in which Old Testament passage?
questions.correctAnswer: Leviticus 19:18
questions.explanation: Jesus' command to love one another echoes Leviticus 19:18, which commands loving one's neighbor, showing continuity of love in Scripture (John 13:34-35).

questions.question: Why does Jesus tell Peter, 'The cock shall not crow, till thou hast denied me thrice'?
options: To foretell Peter's denial and test his faith
To symbolize the coming of dawn
questions.correctAnswer: To foretell Peter's denial and test his faith
questions.explanation: Jesus foretells Peter’s denial three times before the rooster crows, highlighting human weakness and the need for repentance (John 13:38).

questions.question: What is the significance of the 'one whom Jesus loved' reclining on Jesus' bosom during the supper?
options: It indicates intimacy and close relationship with Jesus
It signifies leadership over the other disciples
It symbolizes the coming of the Holy Spirit
questions.correctAnswer: It indicates intimacy and close relationship with Jesus
questions.explanation: The disciple 'whom Jesus loved' reclining on Jesus’ bosom reflects deep friendship and intimacy, highlighting relational themes (John 13:23).

theological.title: John Chapter 13 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from John Chapter 13 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: In John 13, what is the significance of Jesus washing His disciples' feet?
options: It demonstrates the necessity of humility and servanthood among believers
It was a ritual cleansing for ceremonial purity
It was to show His superiority over the disciples
It was to physically clean their feet before the meal
questions.correctAnswer: It demonstrates the necessity of humility and servanthood among believers
questions.explanation: John 13:4-17 shows Jesus humbling Himself to wash the disciples’ feet as an example of servant leadership, commanding them to do likewise. This echoes biblical teachings such as Philippians 2:5-8 on Christ’s humility, Mark 10:45 on servant leadership, and Micah 6:8 on acting justly and humbly with God.

questions.question: Who did Jesus identify as the one who would betray Him during the Last Supper?
options: John, the disciple whom Jesus loved
questions.correctAnswer: Judas Iscariot
questions.explanation: John 13:21-30 narrates Jesus revealing Judas as the betrayer by giving him the dipped sop. This fulfills the Old Testament prophecy in Psalm 41:9 about betrayal by a close friend and aligns with the synoptic accounts in Matthew 26:21-25 and Mark 14:18-21.

questions.question: According to John 13, what must happen if one does not receive those whom Jesus sends?
options: They do not receive Jesus nor God who sent Him
questions.correctAnswer: They do not receive Jesus nor God who sent Him
questions.explanation: John 13:20 teaches that receiving Christ's sent messengers is equivalent to receiving Christ and God Himself, highlighting the unity between the Father, Son, and their mission. This reflects the Johannine emphasis on divine mission (John 17:18) and the authority of Christ's apostles (Acts 9:15).

questions.question: What new commandment did Jesus give to His disciples in John 13?
options: That you love one another as I have loved you
That you observe the Sabbath strictly
That you keep the Passover annually
questions.correctAnswer: That you love one another as I have loved you
questions.explanation: John 13:34 presents the new commandment to love one another with the same love Jesus showed, emphasizing sacrificial and self-giving love. This love is central to Jesus’ teaching (Matthew 22:37-40), is echoed in 1 John 4:7-12, and fulfills the law (Romans 13:8-10).

questions.question: What warning does Jesus give to Peter about his forthcoming denial?
options: Peter will deny Jesus three times before the cock crows
Peter will betray Jesus like Judas
Peter will flee but not deny Him
questions.correctAnswer: Peter will deny Jesus three times before the cock crows
questions.explanation: John 13:38 predicts Peter’s triple denial before the rooster crows, which is fulfilled in the Passion narratives (Matthew 26:69-75, Luke 22:54-62). This underlines human weakness and the necessity of divine grace for perseverance (Psalm 51:17; 2 Corinthians 12:9).

questions.question: What does Jesus say about the servant in relation to his lord in John 13?
options: The servant is not greater than his lord
The servant is greater than his lord
The servant and lord are equals
The servant should rule over his lord
questions.correctAnswer: The servant is not greater than his lord
questions.explanation: John 13:16 states that a servant cannot be greater than his master, emphasizing humility and submission. This reflects the biblical principle of authority and service (Philippians 2:5-7), and Christ's own example as servant and Lord (Isaiah 53:12).

questions.question: Why did Jesus say that not all the disciples were clean after washing their feet?
options: Because He knew one would betray Him
Because some had not washed before supper
questions.correctAnswer: Because He knew one would betray Him
questions.explanation: John 13:10-11 clarifies that Jesus knew who would betray Him, hence not all were clean. This highlights the presence of sin and betrayal within the inner circle of disciples, fulfilling Old Testament prophecy about betrayal (Psalm 41:9) and demonstrating Jesus’ foreknowledge (Isaiah 53:11).

questions.question: What does Jesus say will cause all men to know that His disciples belong to Him?
options: If they have love one for another
If they keep the law perfectly
questions.correctAnswer: If they have love one for another
questions.explanation: John 13:35 teaches that love among believers is the defining mark of discipleship. This aligns with Jesus' teaching on love as the greatest commandment (Matthew 22:37-39), the fruit of the Spirit (Galatians 5:22), and a witness to the world (1 Peter 3:8-9).

questions.question: What does Jesus mean when He tells Peter, 'Whither I go, thou canst not follow me now; but thou shalt follow me afterwards'?
options: Peter cannot follow Jesus immediately because of his coming denial, but will follow Him after His resurrection
Peter is forbidden from going anywhere with Jesus
Peter will follow Jesus only after the ascension
questions.correctAnswer: Peter cannot follow Jesus immediately because of his coming denial, but will follow Him after His resurrection
questions.explanation: John 13:36 indicates Jesus foretelling Peter’s temporary inability to follow due to his imminent denial (John 18:15-27), but promises future faithful following after the resurrection. This reflects themes of repentance and restoration (Luke 22:32).

questions.question: What is the theological significance of Jesus stating 'Now is the Son of man glorified' after Judas left?
options: The glorification refers to Jesus’ impending crucifixion and exaltation
It means Jesus was praised at that moment
It implies Jesus had completed His ministry
It means Jesus was physically glorified
questions.correctAnswer: The glorification refers to Jesus’ impending crucifixion and exaltation
questions.explanation: John 13:31-32 frames the glorification as Jesus’ passion and resurrection, where God is glorified in Him. This aligns with John 12:23-24 and Isaiah 52:13, showing how suffering leads to exaltation.

questions.question: What does Jesus mean by saying 'He that is washed needeth not save to wash his feet, but is clean every whit'?
options: The believer is spiritually clean, but still needs cleansing from daily sins
Physical washing is all that is needed
Only the feet need to be washed for cleanliness
questions.correctAnswer: The believer is spiritually clean, but still needs cleansing from daily sins
questions.explanation: John 13:10 uses washing of feet as a metaphor: baptism cleanses spiritually, but believers still need daily repentance (Psalm 51:2-7; 1 John 1:7-9). This distinguishes initial salvation from ongoing sanctification.

questions.question: How does John 13 portray Jesus’ awareness of His divine mission and origin?
options: Jesus knows He came from God and is going to God
Jesus is uncertain about His origin
Jesus claims to be independent from God
Jesus speaks only as a man without divine knowledge
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus knows He came from God and is going to God
questions.explanation: John 13:3 states Jesus’ knowledge that the Father has given all things into His hands and that He came from God and is returning to God. This reveals His divine origin and mission, consistent with John 1:1-3, 10:30, and Philippians 2:6-11.

questions.question: What is implied by Jesus taking a towel and girding Himself before washing the disciples' feet?
options: He assumed the role of a servant to teach humility
He was performing a priestly ritual
He was getting ready for battle
questions.correctAnswer: He assumed the role of a servant to teach humility
questions.explanation: John 13:4-5 shows Jesus girding Himself like a servant to wash feet, an act of humility and service, modeling servant leadership. This reflects Isaiah 42:1-7’s Servant motif and Philippians 2:5-8.

questions.question: What does Jesus say about the happiness of those who know His teachings and do them?
options: Happy are you if you do them
questions.correctAnswer: Happy are you if you do them
questions.explanation: John 13:17 emphasizes the blessedness of obedience to Jesus’ teachings, consistent with Psalm 1:1-3 and James 1:22-25, which link happiness and blessing to living out God’s word.

questions.question: What does Jesus mean by saying 'He that eateth bread with me hath lifted up his heel against me'?
options: One who shares fellowship with Him will betray Him
questions.correctAnswer: One who shares fellowship with Him will betray Him
questions.explanation: John 13:18 quotes Psalm 41:9, showing betrayal by a close companion, underscoring the tragic reality of Judas’ betrayal and the fulfillment of scripture, highlighting sin’s infiltration even among Jesus’ closest followers.
